questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: Study Source A. Is the cartoonist a supporter of Bangladesh garment villages?  Explain your answer using details from the source.

questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: Study Sources B and C. How far does Source B agree with Source C? Explain your answer.

questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: Study Source D. Are you surprised by what the trade minister said? Explain your answer.

questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: Study Sources E and F. Which source is more useful in showing the impact of garment factories? Explain your answer.

questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: "Global trade benefits the poor worker.‟ Using sources in this case study, explain how far you would agree with this statement.

questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: Extract 1 shows the increasing number of inter-ethnic marriages in Singapore. In your opinion, what are the reasons for this increase? Explain your answer using two reasons.

questions.subject: Humanities(Social_Studies)
questions.question: Extracts 2 and 3 highlights the different approaches to healthcare adopted by Sweden and Singapore. Do you think that government-financed approach is more effective in meeting the needs of the people than the shared responsibility approach? Explain your answer
